website_summaries.verdict: Sennheiser's HD 700 isn't just one of the best-sounding headphone models we've tested, it's also remarkably comfortable to wear for hours at a time.
pros: The Sennheiser HD 700 is a large, full-size audiophile headphone model with a wide-open sound profile and transparency that sounds great on digital music players
cons: The HD 700 is very expensive, so some buyers might be put off by the amount of plastic used in the design

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Sound and Incredible Value
customer_reviews.text: These are the most incredible sounding headphones that I've ever heard. I thought that nothing under $1000 would beat my beloved Hifiman Sundara but the HD-700 does! At less than $500. There is no treble spike nor harshness whatsoever. The most lifelike reproduction of voice strings and especially piano that I've ever heard. And these are nowhere near as hard to drive as I've seen written before. Much easier than my Hifiman Sundara and HE400i. Easier than the Sennheiser HD-650 and simply sound better than any of those headphones. Absolutely no negatives. None.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great sound. Great comfort. Crappy cord. Older Senn's are better.
customer_reviews.text: These phones are fantastic. Yes, a lot of ppl don't like the highs, but I do. Very clear and precise w/ a great soundstage. Are they worth the money. I think so. I've got normal ears, so they fit great. Senn seems to have reduced the size of the ear pieces in newer models. I've returned two sets of newer Senn headphones because of this. The HD 700's are exceptionally comfortable. Ya, the cord sucks, but I'm not listening to the cord. Thank you for your time.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent audiophile cans, precise, and neutral.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived today as promised, so I put on the Beatles White Album and heard some things I’ve never noticed. These HD 700 are showing some excellent clarity, definition, and quick response across the spectrum. Thinking the treble will continue to grow with usage. As others have noted, they have a slight dip in the mid highs. I found their midrange and bass more than either of my other cans. (Grado 225e, Hifiman Mann 400i). Comfort is light around the ears, and the weight is very light, while they tend to slip a little when leaning back. Overall, these are audiophile standard that one could be proud to own.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gray

customer_reviews.title: Life changing for someone new to quality audio.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile so my opinion won't matter I'm sure haha. But I'll say this, the HD 700s are LIFE CHANGING. I've been living in the dark listening to muddy distorted audio from cheap crappy cans. I went back and listened to songs I've heard thousands of times with these cans and it was like I was listening to them for the first time again. Such clarity, detail, and depth. Best purchase EVER. If good audio was like a TV panel, I've been watching 720p this whole time. So glad to upgrade to 4k lol.
customer_reviews.author: Beasty

customer_reviews.title: Big soundstage, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.text: The HD700 is pretty well-built. It's light and comfortable to wear. The stock cable on the other hand is a different story. It's flimsy at best. Sound quality wise, it's true that HD700 has a wide and deep sound stage. One of the best out there in headphone market. But it's also true that the treble is over-strengthened, making it suitable for only a few genres. The mids are way too weak. The piano sounds distorted when played in mid. Guess I would return this and get a more balanced one.
customer_reviews.author: Zhen L.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Warehouse Clutch Find!
customer_reviews.text: Have been looking for these for a while since they've been discontinued and AW managed to have one in stock. Picked it up, a little beat up, and pads have seen better days, but otherwise solid set of headphones. And at 1/3 MSRP, was a no brainer. Don't try and compare these to the 650 or 800 or 800s. They are their own unique set of headphones and sound signature. You love it or you don't. Fortunately, I do! And the comfort is without a doubt the best most well balanced weighted cans you can put on your head.
customer_reviews.author: -ssantokki

customer_reviews.title: Really Great for HiFi Music, Not Much Else
customer_reviews.text: While using these I heard things in my music that I haven't experienced before. The detail is amazing. They worked best while using Tidal HiFi FLAC and MQA. They sounded mediocre using other streaming services. Also they were only good for music. I tried playing a game with them and there was this empty muffled sound that wasn't immediate. I tried watching TV and movies with them and they didn't live up to the hype. While listening to HiFi music, however, these sound amazing. I just didn't think it was worth the money to use these only to listen to music when I can use other headsets for everything.
customer_reviews.author: iLuvAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy with great sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mostly for the reported comfort and I haven't been disappointed. They remain comfortable for hours on end and taking them off is almost weird because there's zero sense of relief like taking shoes off at the end of the day, with these it's like nothing was even on your head and moment ago. They also sound great even at the low levels necessary in the office to keep my music to myself but really shine hooked into my old analog receiver. Sound fine and get plenty loud plugged into a phone as well.
customer_reviews.author: Luke S.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best musical investments I’ve made
customer_reviews.text: One of the best musical investments I’ve made. This professional headphone is awesome and I highly recommend them to all audiophiles. They make your music files sound absolutely musical and allow you to experience the full range of your vocals and instrumentals as if you were there in the studio with the artist. Got them! You want regret your decision.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Eason

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous Sound ...worth the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical these could be better than the 650s I own but they are. Maybe best a\v buy for me ever. I use them with Sonarworks High Fi and they are a tremendous tremendous headphone...they are to sound what wet is to water...☺
customer_reviews.author: Smackacheck

customer_reviews.title: Bought it in April 2019. A great purchase so far.
customer_reviews.text: I use this headset mainly for gaming purposes. For those types of games in which sound plays a key part when it comes to winning or losing, this is the best headset to go for IMO. It just gives you a lot of information about your surroundings in-game while your opponents might not notice you are even around if they had some poor quality headsets on.
customer_reviews.author: lollipop

customer_reviews.title: Huge soundstage, great quality, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Sennheiser makes the best set of headphones IMO. Great company with great customer suppor. The HD 700 have awesome sound stage for playing games.I could hear so much better and the Comfort level is out of this world. They are very light and well-made. So comfortable that they don't even feel like you have headphones on. Bought them used had no problems with the headset or the packaging. Great price for headset.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Lichliter

customer_reviews.title: They sound great, even without an amp, though it's a must to have one.
customer_reviews.text: The product I bought it used, but it came in time and in great condition. They are worth the price, I don't regret spending the money on them. They are light although I thought they would be lighter and came is quite thick and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: lemardo Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones
customer_reviews.text: I loved them very much when I got them, used them for a while and then bought the HD 6XX from Massdrop (which are rebranded HD 650). And I forgot about the 700 for a while. Recently, I started using the 700 and after a short adjustment period, I really have forgotten how good they sound.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Natan

customer_reviews.title: Crap construction
customer_reviews.text: Absolute crap. The little crappy metal arm that holds the ear cup WILL break and when it does, not even Mcguyver can fix it. And the useless maker WILL NOT SEND YOU A DAMN THING TO FIX IT. Screwed out of $900
customer_reviews.author: CalFord

customer_reviews.title: I'd like to own the HD-800S someday
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps too revealing? Will make less-than-perfect recordings almost unlistenable due to harshness in the lower treble. I fall back to Sennheiser HD600s for such recordings, which are more forgiving but, alas, less transparent and with a narrower soundstage and less bass extension than the HD700. For well-recorded tracks, however, the HD-700 headphones are my go-to and are awe-inspiring -- thank you Sennhesier. I'd like to own the HD-800S someday, to compare. The HD-700 headphones are also extremely comfortable, moreso than any HD-6xx headphone in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: John Ghanem

customer_reviews.title: If you’re on the fence, read this.
customer_reviews.text: Personally, these are my favorite set of headphones in my collection. Sound stage, comfort, aesthetics; look I could sit here and list positive attributes for 10 minutes, but that would waste my time writing and your time reading. Their fabulous, if you’re on the fence, I’d suggest you hop off and buy these and stop spending hours scouring the internet looking for the best option (unless I’m the only one who does that sort of thing... :P). Last point: they surpass the HD800s IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: The perfect sound
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphone. The sound quality is just amazing - as described in many other reviews. The problem is that you will have a hard time to find something similar. The headsets are very comfortable to wear and the sound quality remains stable, which isn't necessarilys the case with my in-ear headphones i-80. Haven't heard anything so close to a perfect sound.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: The best I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I read about these online, and had a friend tell me over and over again that I had to buy them. She was right. If you're listening to music, the soundscape is astonishing. There are many more technical reviews out there, but I'll just say that for me, this is undreamt of audio.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Sound staging is extremely accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I am gamer and streamer and I must say these are the best headphones you can buy for FPS games. The sound staging on these headphones is extremely sharp and the footsteps and gunshots are accurately described by the audio from the headphones. I have them plugged into my GOXLR. I haven’t heard the HD800 S for gaming but honestly at this point those are the only headphones that MIGHT be better than these.
customer_reviews.author: RobDollas

customer_reviews.title: Different and better than lower model HDs
customer_reviews.text: More detail and staging, can enjoy music at lower volumes. The treble can be shrill on some sources. I love for classical but use on all recordings to hear what I was missing. You can always equalize to your taste, but getting this much resolution and instrument placement is preferred once you have heard it. The best headphones I own. I use with "Mojo" portable amp even when at home.
customer_reviews.author: Voluntary E.

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I've tried to date comfortable don't get hot ...
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I've tried to date comfortable don't get hot after long periods of time with them on and large range frequency which makes them great for all kinds of music as well as tv shows an movies. They also feel very sturdy unlike bests that squeak and feel like they can break at any time. There open so not meant for travel unless you don't care about people hearing what your listening to because you have to turn up the volume to drown them out. But for around the house, office or dorm/barracks there great
customer_reviews.author: Branden

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome headphones. Acoustics are a bit more treble heavy than most of the Sennheiser line and can be a touch harsh at first if you're not used to a higher sound signature. All that said I really like the sounds and it is still distinctively Sennheiser, if you've tried their headphones before and liked them then these will be great.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan T.

customer_reviews.title: Changed the upgrade line.  7n single The sound quality of the original line is not good.
customer_reviews.text: Changed the upgrade line. 7n single crystal copper silver plating is greatly improved. The sound quality of the original line is not good.
customer_reviews.author: lin r.

customer_reviews.title: These are the best headphones I've used so far
customer_reviews.text: These are the best headphones I've used so far. The clarity is incredible and they're comfortable enough to wear for hours without creating sore spots or sweaty ears. The included cable is more than enough to reach my amplifier from across the room with enough slack to be able to sit comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for the only purpose I bought them for which is gaming and they have went above and beyond my expectations. These paired with a modmic 5.0 have made me a custom top of the line gaming headset.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST YOU CAN BUY.
customer_reviews.text: They are expensive but if you use headphones a lot they are worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: super comfortable and great sound
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding quality, super comfortable and great sound! A bit warm for studio usage, but still great for amateur musicians. I loved them so much I'm considering traveling with them, but it's probably a bad idea because aren't meant for portability. It's a great deal, I totally recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio Daniel González

customer_reviews.title: Never going back.
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of headphones I have ever had. Sound amazing. Paired this with Schiit Dac/amps and I will never go back to regular headphones. Defiantly worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: R N

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Birthday gift for teenage grandson. He absolutely loves these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: PMH

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are extremely comfortable and sound amazing
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are extremely comfortable and sound amazing. I have these paired to the E10K DAC/Headphone amp, they make a nice pair.
customer_reviews.author: David VanHouse

customer_reviews.title: Luxury Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. I use them when playing my synth, and listening to them through a DAC connected to my PC. They are really luxury headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent upgrade from the HD 595, and worth the extra cash.
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal sounding and comfortable. They are much clearer and more detailed than my HD 595 headphones. A worthwhile upgrade. I use the FiiO E10K USB DAC amp with these and it drives them perfectly. The build quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jay S

customer_reviews.title: Skip These
customer_reviews.text: Really not great. Soundstage seems unnaturally wide. Sound is very blah. Buy any variant of the 600s over these.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound buy them
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these for many months and finally bought them they are outstanding
customer_reviews.author: Identity not given

customer_reviews.title: If you can afford it and the price has dropped ...
customer_reviews.text: If you can afford it and the price has dropped steadily the past few years, your ears will thank you profusely every time you don these headphones to listen to music.
customer_reviews.author: Edward L

customer_reviews.title: Second Pair Returned
customer_reviews.text: Same issues with cable and distorted audio at levels that are not even excessive. Buy the HD660s
customer_reviews.author: Ian M Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely a new experience
customer_reviews.text: Best in my collection! Like I've never listened to music before
customer_reviews.author: ImpartialReviews

customer_reviews.title: A grateful doubter hangs in there...
customer_reviews.text: Well, I finally found what I was looking for! I. I'm a long time Sennheiser fan. And when I decided to upgrade I went to the HD 600,then tried the HD 650. I was disappointed with both, and returned them. So, not wanting to give up, I, with trepidation, thought I'd stick with Sennheiser and so I timidly ordered the HD 700.And crossed my fingers. Hooray! The HD 700 is not only good its better than I imagined it could be, and I'm glad that I made the leap.
customer_reviews.author: Kierkegaard

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: They are wonderful.... detailed at the high end but the wide soundstage is awsome !! I love them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Delos

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful headphones. I paired them with an Oppo HA-2 headphone amp and I was blown away. Thoroughly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: TheIman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how you can dog these headphones...especially at $425. They're clear and articulate. The stereo imaging is very good. The bass is spot on. I can see how these could be called bright...a simple EQ tweak chills that out. Overall, I'm happy with the purchase. Wife even commented on the audio quality and she could care less in most situations. Just for reference, these phones are being fed by a ASUS STX II sound card.
customer_reviews.author: JT7

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sounding headphones.
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic pair of headphones, I have tried a few cans in the past from the HD480s from the 1990's all the way up to modern design Beats Audio and NAD offerings. I just wish I had enough change to put down on the 800s.
customer_reviews.author: Grotster

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Headset
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable headset I’ve ever owned. Soundstage is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Connor O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Great compliment to HD 800
customer_reviews.text: Recently came back from an HD 800. Also currently own a K712. Slightly narrower sound stage than HD800. Still extremely wide, and surprisingly Comfortable , lighter, extremely stylish. Bass is more volumeous than the HD800, highs and mids are really similar, if not identical. Compared to my K712, the headphone is warmer and more fun. Now that these have started coming down in price, I think they're really starting to punch at their price point, especially considering that more expensive equipment (such as the HD800's/LCD3's/etc) tend to require an equally expensive amplifier to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sennheiser headphone have very nice sound. I like them very much.
customer_reviews.author: Bw

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It makes music more pleasant and vivid, the difference could even be felt by hearing YouTube and MP3 (based on my Korg DS-DAC-10R amplifier). Pretty good purchasing experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Lo

customer_reviews.title: It's half the size & weight of most of the cans it sounds like. The comfort is incredible
customer_reviews.text: It really surprised me. It's half the size & weight of most of the cans it sounds like. The comfort is incredible, soundstage & imaging is off the charts, detail rivals cans three times the price. Awesome for gaming, watching movies & most music jonrah. Well worth the expense. Don't ask questions just buy it if your pockets let you.
customer_reviews.author: rasta

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this headset with the audio quest black 1.5 is magnifico
customer_reviews.author: john k.

customer_reviews.title: Really close to perfection balanced into an Oppo HA-1
customer_reviews.text: Actually yeah, not too shabby. Can kinda see the potential now with what an HD800S might bring to the party and will eventually find the extra USD$1600 for a pair. Although a long time experienced home audiophile I'm new to higher end headphone listening. Loving it. I am currently running Sennheiser a balanced cable with the HD 700 into an Oppo HA-1 and am so so impressed, especially when digital conversion happens directly inside the Oppo then converts to analog straight to balanced headphone out. Superb fun.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: They're obviously great headphones, but make sure the sound signature appeals to you before sinking any money into them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really Exceptional Headphones
customer_reviews.text: One of the best sounding and looking headphones. They sound great without an amp, but the soundstage would definitely benefit from more power.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones after EQ
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones after EQ, but after three months of light desktop use the overly engineered cable is dropping signal to the right driver.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Simply the best for your money. Pair with a FiiO 12 and your done.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Willie

customer_reviews.title: Feel and sound amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Best headset I've ever put on. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: tyler edens

customer_reviews.title: man mid still super clear and high still crisp and sparkle
customer_reviews.text: Who said HD700 is just for non-bass heavy music? I EQ it and... man mid still super clear and high still crisp and sparkle.... BASS is rock... no distortion! With current price! absolutely worth the money! However you must have a decent headphone amp to drive it.... or if you have AV receivers that will be fine too. Sennheiser is the must go brand for headphone ( I have IE80 and Momentum M1)
customer_reviews.author: NIKE2000

customer_reviews.title: You are paying for quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, open ear means everyone can hear you, but these headphones are for use at home more than out and about. If you are a fan of over-powering, farty bass then these are not the headphones for you. If you like to hear the high and mid ranges without bass overpowering everything else *cough* Beats *cough* then these are phenomenal. The plastic build is not a turn off for me, but many may not want to purchase $500+ headphones that are made of plastic (even if it is reinforced with metal)
customer_reviews.author: Hahnzo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound when your ready to step up
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound when your ready to step up. Works well with any device but you will need a good DAC or amp for this to be worth it. Currently using it to watch movies and with the Vive. Using a MSI Z170A Gaming M9 ACK and DiMarzio Black Headphone Extension cable. Not a complete audiophile setup yet but getting there.
customer_reviews.author: LKNANML

customer_reviews.title: EQ + Discount = Happy
customer_reviews.text: Not worth full price but still decent. The highs are significantly too sharp/piercing. I would go as far as to say the highs are painful for EDM style music. I was able to solve the problem with an EQ and now the head phones sound amazing. With that being said, you shouldn't need to "fix" headphones at the usual MSRP price. I only recommend these for people that are going to run them through an EQ and only for a heavily discounted price. I got mine for 500 and I'm more or less happy with it though if I had paid full price I would have sent them back in a heart beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My superb headphone
customer_reviews.text: Go to head-fi for more detailed and techie review of this can. All I can say is, after I heard those, I am going to throw all 3 of my Bose in Ohio river. To replace the IEM MIE2, I already picked up a CX890i. One quick note, do use a DAC if hearing with iPhone. You will need a decent headphone amp to unchain this beast.
customer_reviews.author: SDeep

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and great soundstage
customer_reviews.text: Good sound and great soundstage, just have to say that at higher frequencies the distortion is very noticeable especially on a solid state amp. If you have a tube amp, you will fare better, and might even come to like the sound. For me it was very decently priced, but I still ended up returning it as it wasn't worth price difference between my 600s
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent choice. Not so expencive like HD800s. Smooth to keep on ears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: really shines with good headphone amp
customer_reviews.text: Can be driven off a device...really shines with good headphone amp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you like clarity these are a good choice
customer_reviews.text: If you like clarity these are a good choice. If your looking for over emphasized bass you"ii might want to look at something else. They are comfortable for extended ware. Sound does leak out of them because they are an open back headphone. I also own a pair of Bang & Oliufsen headphones and the popular Audio-Technica ATH-M50's. I listen to the HD 700's most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight D. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Sound Like Klipsch Hereseys
customer_reviews.text: These have what I would call "great" sound, like my vintage Klipsch Hereseys had when they were new. I returned them because at the levels I listen at they were distorting. The player I was using should have worked but I suspect they would have been perfectly fine if I'd have been using a dedicated headphone amplifier. I plan to replace these with the HD800 model and use a Marantz HD-AMP1.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Salomon

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Just received these Thursday 10/27/2016 and they are not "sibilant" (hope they won't be) as of yet. I've only used them couple of hours and they sound more open than the HD 650's I had (vailed). I also had the HD 800's (the originals not the newer S version) and couldn't listen to them for longer than 30-40 minutes as the treble was very sibilant, I ended up selling them. So I will try to give a full review some time at a later date, but for nodw these are smooth sailing!
customer_reviews.author: V. K. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: If bass is the only thing you care about in sound, then these are not for you. If any part of you doesn't fit that description, these are wonderful. Pleasantly screeching highs, crisp mids, not too intrusive but cleanly powerful lows, and a great sound stage make these fit up my headphone alley better than any I've had before. They are also the most comfortable headphones I've ever encountered, even after 5-6 hours of continuous use, it is very easy to forget you're even wearing them. 100% worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphone
customer_reviews.text: This is the finest headphone I have ever owned. I have a Stax Lambda and I loved it as well, but this outperforms it, even though it does not have to have a pre-amplifier. Indeed, I bought this phone precisely so I could use it without the preamplifier, and was surprised to here it outperform the Stax. Of course, it has the virtues of a "plug and play" headphone. The base is better and has more "punch," though less than a less expensive headphone. The design is excellent and it is comfortable. I is quite pricey and I would not recommend it if one does not want to use it on high quality material. Otherwise, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones, but make sure you have an appropriate ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones, but make sure you have an appropriate soundcard or DAC/AMP to run these! For serious audiophiles only. However, well worth the money. For those looking for a cheaper alternative that does not require the extra peripherals to use this, consider the 598 by Sennheiser as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W.

customer_reviews.title: Harsh treble but huge soundstage
customer_reviews.text: One of the biggest soundstage ever heard on a headphone for me. Treble can be too harsh at times but aftermarket cables can do the trick of taming the treble and giving it much more bass.
customer_reviews.author: Xamdou

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful to my ears.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful to my ears. Definitely a step-up from my HE-400S. No complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kayode

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Hearing songs I've listened to for years in a complete different light. Perfectly comfortable with very minimum to no fatigue. Great for reviewing/listening to recordings Best music listening experience of my life.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sounding!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible sounding! I also have a set of HD 598's. The 598's are great sounding headphones and very comfortable. Since these HD700's were reasonably priced and had such good reviews I took the chance on them to see if they really improve on the sound. All I can say is WOW! The sound is incredible. They really bring out the difference in hi res audio. The soundstage is perfect. The bass is smooth as butter and the highs are just the right balance. Worth every bit of the price. I'm very happy! I have to go now, the music is calling...
customer_reviews.author: Mmerle

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, open sounding, and detailed. Should be driven by good amp with good DAC.
customer_reviews.author: Juanf

customer_reviews.title: excellent headphone
customer_reviews.text: Very clear, very original taste of the music, better effect for moden music than HD800. Well balanced for all type of music.
customer_reviews.author: wenqi wang

customer_reviews.title: Beast!
customer_reviews.text: coming from HD280 pros which were great... BUT these are amazing! the sound is very crisp and clean. Bass is good and not overwhelming. they fit amazing and dont hurt even after long (6 hours) use. I use my yamaha receiver to power these so cant comment on how a phone or something would fair. overall i love these headphones so much so that i have a nice home theater and debate which to listen to music with often. oh and the long cord is great and so is the fact that it is modular so that if it wears from use you can get another cord.
customer_reviews.author: T_Fizzle

customer_reviews.title: hd700 vs static electricity
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I have owned, unfortunately the hd700 lost one battle vs static electricity from my sheets and died. Rip.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: good headphone indeed. just not for me.
customer_reviews.text: very good headphone. high level of comfort. not amp. picky. very nice. cons: recessed mids - bad for my tastes (i like my mids forward not the other way around)
customer_reviews.author: Eyal S.

customer_reviews.title: but good value for the
customer_reviews.text: No as detailed as the 800s ,but good value for the price
customer_reviews.author: Jack Mofor

customer_reviews.title: $60 for replacement ear pads (warranty won't cover)
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, however, the cover on my left ear pad has torn, revealing the yellow foam underneath. I called Sennheiser, they told me the warranty doesn't cover it, and a new pair of ear pads costs $59.45.
customer_reviews.author: cycle.d.shaped

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item at a excellent price. I get it with only 600 bucks. working well with my C4 amplifier and the sounds is perfect. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Li Ji

customer_reviews.title: what can I say but what excellent cans.
customer_reviews.text: At work so not much time..what can I say but what excellent cans...Have the 650's, and had to get these...some day the 800's!
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Monahan

customer_reviews.title: It is the best you could have for head phones
customer_reviews.text: It is the best you could have for head phones, and it was the best price I could find. I felt I was in the Studio listing to the music on this Head Phones.
customer_reviews.author: P.M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent headphones that work well over hearing aids. Clear, crisp sound.
customer_reviews.author: Linda P********r

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones as long as you have a great DAC and AMP. Only con I can say about these is they make older videos on youtube unbearable. They amplify every pop and bit of static in the video that you don't hear in lesser products. However, in better quality audio sources they bring out parts of songs, background noises, and settle changes you would never hear on other products. They are also VERY light in a good way and you forget they are on you 5 minutes into wearing them. The cable is also amazing that you can not hear interference when it brushes on your shirt, desk, anything.
customer_reviews.author: terry

customer_reviews.title: For 650, this headphone is awesome.  The confrt, the sound, the clarity, the tiny details, this headphone does it all n more!
customer_reviews.text: I currently have an ultrasone 750 pro closed back headphone. I bought this as an upgrade to my current headphone and IT SHOWS. Everything is better with this headphone; from tiny details to the soundstage and there is a distinct clarity on all the songs I have that I did not notice with my old headphone. Definitely worth the 650 price tag. The music feels more lively and the confort that this headphone provides is TOP NOTCH. The design of the cups go over your ears. The padding they use is very confortable. I did not feel any strain on my ears at all, even after 2-3 hours of listening to music. 5/5 stars
customer_reviews.author: tloppa

customer_reviews.title: simply in few words it's perfect headphone for all types of
customer_reviews.text: simply in few words it's perfect headphone for all types of music
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed Hekmat

customer_reviews.title: Best set of headphones I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best set of headphones I've ever owned. I've had them for months and they still amaze me. If you are going to use them with iphone, invest in a DAC
customer_reviews.author: Jose B

customer_reviews.title: Works great with some mobile players.
customer_reviews.text: these are a clear sounding & comfortable headphones that works great with LG V20 phone + it sounds nice even with a 2013 15" Macbook pro w/retina headphone out, but i didnt like the sound when it was paired with DAP like the fiio x5 3rd. also it would be nice to have a short 3.5mm cable in the box + i think in this day and age bluetooth headphones are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: rakan

customer_reviews.title: sol republic cable works!
customer_reviews.text: Best ever Christmas gift. The sound is amazing. I use my old sol republic cable to hook up with iPhone. It is better than a stupid 3.5mm adapter. This is like a drug. I cannot write too much, music is calling.........
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Don't always believe what is written...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones. Don't always believe what is written and just take a listen for yourself. I was apprehensive as these get very mixed reviews, but for my tastes, they are superb. Dynamic, fast, revealing, it's not the fault of the headphones if they reveal flaws in some recordings.
customer_reviews.author: Sophat Ngim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Under estimated amazing headphones, closers in quality to HD800 than it is to HD700. I love it

customer_reviews.text: Could use a little more bass response but I was expecting this.

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: i love music so i bought this head phone this is very good. looks very good. listening very good also.
customer_reviews.author: lie lin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound. I previously had the HD 650's which ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound. I previously had the HD 650's which were great. The sound detail and the COMFORT of these HD700's is unparalleled. So glad they are made in Ireland too and not Chinese junk.
customer_reviews.author: J. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones ever!!! To enjoy them at their best you will need an amp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased
customer_reviews.text: I have noticed the difference with these, specially when gaming. They are very light and stay on your head! Glad I purchased!
customer_reviews.author: T. Roybal

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones BUT
customer_reviews.text: If you wanted a head phone to disconnect from society these aren't it. The sound bleeds A LOT. If you're listening to music or watching a movie everyone will be able to hear exactly what you're listening to. I'm sending them back for that reason. Good headphones. Maybe my ears are damaged from listening too of loud music, but these aren't as loud as I hoped. You'll likely need an amp to get the full experience. Doesn't have shake your skull bass, but otherwise these head phones are very crisp.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best headphones I have ever listened to (and I've tried ...
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best headphones I have ever listened to (and I've tried a lot of them). Well worth the steep price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Vedovanera

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level audiophile Headphones for most music
customer_reviews.text: Good entry into audiophile Headphones..Classical sound great ..some pop\rock can sound tinny tho

product_meta.title: Sennheiser HD 700 Headphone (Jack plug ¼” (6.3 mm) stereo) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: Style:Headphones| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingIf the HD 700 headphones were a music group, it would be equally gifted in every style. Whether classic, jazz or rock, it would have sound mastery of each genre. Regardless of what song it’s currently playing, its timbre is always warm and emotional. With its exceptional and unique range, reproduction of the lowest and highest tones that the human ear cannot consciously perceive is now achievable. This is a true maestro and an unforgettable listening experience suited for every musical taste.
feature_bullets: Specially tuned, highly efficient drivers capable of delivering high sound pressure levels and a flat frequency response. Nominal impedance: 150 ohms
Highly optimized ventilated magnet system minimizes air turbulence and harmonic, intermodulation distortion. Sound pressure level : 105 dB. THD, total harmonic distortion is less than 0,03 percentage
Open back ear cups facilitate transparent sound while showcasing cutting edge industrial design

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars292 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
